meanings.definition: To cry out loudly in protest or anger.
meanings.sent1: The crowd outcried against the unfair decision.
meanings.sent2: She outcried when she heard the shocking news.
meanings.sent3: The toddler outcried when his toy was taken away.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm outcried its fury throughout the night.
meanings.sent5: The protesters outcried for justice in the streets.

meanings.sent1: He outcried his frustration after the game.
meanings.sent2: They outcried their disappointment at the outcome.
meanings.sent3: The cat outcried for more food, pretending to be starving.
meanings.sent4: The old clock outcried its age with each tick and tock.
meanings.sent5: The students outcried with joy when the bell rang for recess.
